thread.title: Heat grab seventh straight against Pistons, 116-103 | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Heat grab seventh straight against Pistons, 116-103 | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Heat grab seventh straight against Pistons, 116-103 | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 29, 2017 12:09am EST January 28, 2017 10:42pm EST Wayne Ellington was hot from deep in the fourth. NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 28, 2017 | Updated on Jan. 29, 2017 
Jan. 28, 2017 
Goran Dragic had 23 points, Wayne Ellington added 19 as the Heat advanced their win streak to seven burning the Pistons 116-103 in Miami. 
MORE: Kings buzz past Hornets, 109-106 
James Johnson tallied 18 points and Dion Waiters added 17 tying his season high 14 3-pointers. Ellington made three in the space of two minutes to properly pull Miami away. 
The Heat scored 26 while the Pistons only had 12 in the fourth quarter resulting in a cruisey late win for Miami. 
Reggie Jackson had 24 points and Andre Drummond added 17 points and 20 rebounds for Detroit.
